extracted_data_phrases: in situations where speaking up would have required facing uncomfortable disagreement or criticism

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence, leading me to trust solely in my own abilities?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: solely to my own abilities and efforts

autonomy.question: Did I allow my own independence and free will to become more important than God's existence?
autonomy.description: Deliberately entertaining doubts about God's existence is a sin against faith because it questions the most fundamental truth of our faith and shows a lack of trust in God's clear self-revelation through creation, scripture, and the Church's teachings.

autonomy.question: Did I place exclusive trust in my own abilities, failing to acknowledge the role that God's grace plays in guiding my decisions?
autonomy.description: Pride is self-reliance repeats Lucifer's original sin of wanting independence from God and fails to acknowledge our complete dependence on divine grace.

autonomy.question: Did I solely rely on my own abilities to achieve success, rather than humbly recognizing that my accomplishments are a gift of God's grace?
